Reviews.Title: “This is Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Clydecarey
Reviews.Content: We are an American couple and loved this place. Free espresso! Our room was small but modern and had a great view of the canal. We are in our late 20's and were very happy with the location. It is basically in the red light district and has great bars and food within walking distance or on the same street. We rented bikes across the street and rode to Heiniken and the Van Gogh museum. Very fun and recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great for short city break - but no breakfast facility!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: I would certainly recommend the hotel if you are on a city break in Amsterdam for 2 or 3 nights. The hotel is very central and this is what you need for a short visit. After reading some reviews I was worried that we could have ended up in a very tiny room. But to our surprise it was spacious enough with a double bed. That said once at the reception I've over heard a client complaining that the ceiling at her room was way too low for his very tall boyfriend. (So I guess we just got lucky!). The staff is polite and did its best to find an alternative room (don't know if they managed it as I was leaving to get some food). my biggest complain about this hotel is its lack of breakfast facility. OK, it has a vending machine at the reception but I like warm food in the morning !!!! Except that if you are not bothered about the 'breakfast let down' you should enjoy your stay as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so clean”
Reviews.Author: staceyj82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 603 which has a lovely canal balcony view. The room was pleasant and fairly quiet, no more noise than you would expect in a city centre. However cleanliness appears to be somewhat of a problem....although everything appears to be clean this is not the full story. All down the side of the bed was full of old food,hair etc. The location was brilliant for what we wanted. And reception were very helpful with any queries we had. Overall a good hotel just need to up the cleaning standards

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdames”
Reviews.Author: seagulls2011 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for a hen weekend,rooms a bit small, no attention to room request to be together and no enforcement of no smoking which made the smoke alarms go off every early morning at 2 am. but central for all the tourist centers of the dam

Reviews.Title: “No sleep - but clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kharro
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with an excellent location. However, if you want to sleep during the night this hotel is not the best choice. We were woken up by the fire alarm (someone smoked in their room), people talking in a court yard outside the hotel and in the early Sunday morning hours - the cleaning lady barged in. Perhaps we were unlucky......... Day staff was excellent - the night staff not so much....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the wifi”
Reviews.Author: Djgold
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel and the double rooms opening on to the canal are lovely. My only complaint is that the wifi is not free - â‚¬15 for three days - and only works for one device. If you have a laptop, smartphone and iPad it doesn't work out. It seems mean spirited compared to most other hotels these days. It also means that I only book this hotel when my favourite hotel is full.

Reviews.Title: “really lovely hotel in a quirky location”
Reviews.Author: Jools1979
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in this hotel for a night and found the staff to be friendly and the room nicely decorated in a nice modern style. The bed was lovely with lots of sumptious pillows. The lobby is really well stocked for snacks and drink. The only problem we had was that even when we shut the sash windows, they still sounded open and we were kept wake by people laughing and talking extremely loudly on the street all the way through the night and i mean pretty much most of it. I'd stay here again but would want a room at the back. Was very reasonably priced. Be aware that although they have luggage storage, this is an unlocked cupboard and they advise that you take all your valuables and passports with you.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying a few days in Amsterdam - I stayed three days and the central location was ideal for my stay. Hotel personnel were friendly. Although the room was small, it was clean and had the necessary amenities. Loved the shower - like rainfall. Only negative thing is that I had to pay extra for WIFI in my room.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION TO CENTRAL AMSTERDAM AND ALL THE BARS! VERY COMFY!!”
Reviews.Author: Becki L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel, set in perect location of amsterdam central, few minutes walk from central station and right on top of all the bars/ clubs/ resturants and coffeeshops!! beds were very comfy and bedding nice and cosy, a bit dirty behind beds and cuboards but nothing major. all in all a great hotel and i would definatly go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Faz2012
Reviews.Content: With hotel the check in is normally around 2:00 however we arrived two hours early they allowed us to check in early no charge. The staff are friendly and speak English, the lift takes for ever, at the hotel has loads of rooms you can get lost so best to stick to lift. No smoking but the usual sock trick worked for us.. A 10 min walk from central station or probably less as we took a detour into coffe shop. There are loads of coffe shops, restaurants and supermarkets around the hotel red light district is literally behind the hotel and along the way many shops.. Overall great and good serivce.. Faz

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in the Center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GigHarmon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute based on the price; good reviews on Trip Advisor; and it's location in the center of Amsterdam. Given that many of the hotels in this area seem sketchy based on the reviews, we were thrilled we found an affordable place that was clean, safe, quiet, comfortable, modern, and convenient. The Red-Light District, gay bars, coffee houses, train station, and the Damrak are all right at your doorstep. The room was a perfectaly adequate size for our needs, with a comfy black leather couch, a wardrobe with plenty of room for clothes, comfortable bed, and a slick modern bathroom with your choice of rain-style or removable shower head. We must have paid week-day rates because the rooms were priced significantly higher when I looked to return a weekend later. The service was perfectly fine. When I made my booking, I had put in a special request for an early check-in if possible. Most hotels usually can accommodate me, but I don't really think they were too concerned about it here.

Reviews.Title: “Book now, grat hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ema4Kyle
Reviews.Content: I returned from cc last nite had a wicked time as usual and this is the best hotel I have stayed in over there so far. I booked 2 doubles and a 4 man room and they was all great with excellent bathrooms. Would highly recommended this hotel totally enjoyed 2 night stay. This view was by 8 19-28 years olds. Book now will not be disappointed xx

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Goose564
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in a great location for exploring the dam! Rooms are small but clean - all you need for a city break base. Staff are really friendly and the beds amazing!! Will be returning and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “You'll do well to find a better hotel for the money.....this one is top notch!”
Reviews.Author: Tony R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks researching into hotels in Amsterdam before booking this treasure! We're a lively couple in our mid twenties but are both mature professionals when we're not relaxing on holiday! We stayed here for 3 nights and can only sing it's praises! A lot of reviews complain about hotels in Amsterdam being small with steep staircases and very small rooms. This is true, but if people were to research into things before booking with high expectations, they would soon find out that all buildings are like this as it's how they were originally designed! May I also point out that in Amsterdam, you get what you pay for. If you're away on a break, surely youâ€™re out making the most of your time away and only wash and sleep in your room? Anyways, the staff at the reception were nothing but polite and helpful. We arrived at around 5am on our first day, knowing full well that check in wasnâ€™t until 2pm. The staff informed us that our room was waiting and that we could check in immediately. The room (110) was spotless and we even had use of a safe (that was free of charge). Maids cleaned the room every day without fail and bags and belongings were untouched. The bed was comfortable and the shower was amazing! Hot water was always piping hot from the second the tap was turned on! The hotel is located on a busy street on the outskirts of the Red Light District. The street can get a little busy at night (as to be expected) especially of a weekend. We were fortunate enough to have a room located away from the street. In terms of location, this hotel is extremely well placed! Just a two minute walk to Dam Square in one direction, again the other way for Central Station and again for the Red Light District. My only criticism and I am being really critical! Would be that the window in our room didnâ€™t fully seal along the bottom (less that 1mm gap â€“ so nothing to worry about in terms of security) however, it did mean that at night when it got cold, there was a slight draft if the wind picked up. The extractor fan in the bathroom was not electric, so after a hot shower it got a bit steamy, but was still quick to clear. Would we recommend this hotel? ABSOLUTELY......we loved the city and would stay here time and time again on return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location for night life”
Reviews.Author: Gemma F
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in February 2011 and enjoyed it so much we decided to book again for our second trip to Amsterdam in 2012. After enjoying the first trip so much we were disappointed to be put in what I can only think is one of the smallest rooms in the hotel (room 100 above reception) this room was no bigger than the bed, and the door from the hall opened straight into the room, not ideal when someone is in bed and you want to leave. We decided to stick it out until the next morning when I went down to reception and asked if we could change, the staff on reception couldnt have been more helpful. He gave me a key to another room to see if I liked that before moving. It was a nice room but I had my heart set on the room we had the previous year, I returned to reception and asked if we could have that room, he advised that it wasnt available but if we packed our things and went out for the day they would move our luggage into the room we wanted. I have to say I didnt expect that kind of hospitality or flexability! We continued our stay in room 210, I must recommend that if you are booking a 'small double' as advertised, you request this room, you wont be disappointed! Although it is above the street we both managed to sleep well, but street noise could be a problem if you are a light sleeper. Location of the hotel is great, short walk from the train station, near all the coffee shops, bars, and the 'other' side of the red light district. I would definitely book to stay in this hotel again as I am sure I will be returning to Amsterdam in the near future!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: joelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for any group of people going to Amsterdam for a weekend, or even longer, that want to experience Amsterdam for what it is known for. The hotel is easy access from the airport and although we got a taxi on the way there to the hotel which cost us 45 euro, the hotel is so close to the main train station that we decided to get the train back which was half the price, just as quick and just as easy. The location is perfect, down a typical Amsterdam street just minutes away from Dam square and minutes away from the red light district. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and there are computers in the basement which are free of charge so you can look up anything that they can't answer. The actual rooms are small as most other rooms stay, but big enough. The beds are really comfortable, the rooms are very clean with tea and coffee facilities and even a TV with a few English channels. The noise level was very minimal. Maids came both mornings to clean our rooms and even came back as we weren't ready. The bathroom was really clean and modern and all worked perfectly. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap hotel to stay in the centre of Amsterdam, it's modern, clean, friendly and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of the red light district”
Reviews.Author: TiNA_LiNA_27 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay couldn't comment on service as had no need for some the staff at reception were friendly enough. Rooms were immaculately clean everyday. Fresh towels coffe tea milk and sugar. Rooms are small but have everything you need great showers! Location is perfect if you like going out to bars and coffee shops. Breakfast is not included but you are spoilt for choice with restaurants pubs and cafes. Even though you are in the busiest part of Amsterdam we slept well and didn't hear a peep. Blackout curtains were great too when your Anita worse for wear in the morn! All major attractions are nearby, within walking distance. Will definitely stay again when returning to Dam!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Vivek G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quality, clean and efficient hotel experience, Hotel CC is definately your best bet. The staff are friendly, approachable and go out of their way to help you. The hotel itself is not cased in luxury, but offers a perfect business and leisure get away. The location is not ideal, however is close to the train station. All in all, a very pleasurable experience. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IrishDave2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a conference at the RAI. Super little hotel with a quirky room. My room was backed right onto the canal so was very cool indeed. I didnt expect anything less or anything more. It served a purpose and I slept well. Didnt eat or drink here, but its location is perfect, right int he middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “pretty poor”
Reviews.Author: Wael2011
Reviews.Content: extremlly small rooms, pretty much the size of the bed, very small bathrooms, very noisy, really bad hotel. with the same price you can get much smarter hotel in beutiful Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Many coffeeshops and restaurants nearby. Room was kind small, but clean enough. The staff at the front desk were pleasant and friendly. WiFi too expensive. Parking is 50 EUR per night, too expensive! No breakfast available.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well situated”
Reviews.Author: EMcCScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and quite modern. It is situated close to the central station in Amsterdam (less than 5 mins walk) and is on the street behind Damtrak. The rooms are small but comfortable. The hotel is also well positioned close to Dam square and the red light district. All in all no complaints for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Basically, they ripped me off!”
Reviews.Author: Emma M
Reviews.Content: Through P & O ferries I booked a mini-cruise to Amsterdam. As we were staying overnight in Amsterdam for 1 night I wanted to stay in a nice hotel, but right in the middle of everything. The reviews were quite varied for most of the hotels but I chose Hotel CC in the end as I thought it looked pretty cool. All ready and excited to leave on Thursday for the drive to Hull port from my house I received a phone call from P & O saying because of the weather, bad wind and rain it was not safe to sail. Pretty gutted I rang Lastminute.com whom I booked the hotel through and they put me on hold whilst they contacted the hotel and explained my situation. Understandably the hotel would not give me a refund but said I could choose a different date. After choosing a different date I rang back again, to be told the hotel would not amend my reservation at all? I tried sorting the problem through Lastminute.com who were useless and then contacted the hotel direct, to be given a email full of lies. Firstly they thanked me for booking with them and then apologised for not changing the date of the booking, telling me that they didn't receive any information regarding the 2 telephone conversations? If you are going to rip me off then fine but don't lie about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Location - Groovy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Central Train Station, on the border of the Red Light district and happening area. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms were clean and tidy. Walking distance to most main sights, bars and restaurants. We stayed in room 603 which was on the ground floor, canal facing. Great room...great views, and a lot more spacious to photos being shown in other reviews. Double bed - very comfortable. When comparing to other 3 - 3.5 star hotels which we stayed at during our trip, this is by far the best. Groozy new hotel. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: hopium
Reviews.Content: Hotel CC is a short walk from the central hotel station. The rooms are recently renovated and use the tiny space efficiently. The staff was willing to hold our luggage (in an unlocked room) and was businesslike and courteous. Although our room was near the elevator, we couldn't hear it. However, we could hear the other guests shouting in the hall, so bring ear plugs if you plan to stay in the red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in the Redlight District”
Reviews.Author: Ian T
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how small the rooms were but looked at what else is available in the same price bracket in the area and was shocked how bad the rest were! Its clean and nice but seriously small. I would however recomend it if this is all your budget allows.

Reviews.Title: “best choice for a short layover”
Reviews.Author: alanc929
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for only 1 night. Although I am travelling alone, I booked a small double room on booking.com for less than 100 euros. I had 2 pieces of big luggage and i managed to walk to the hotel from the central station in about 10 or less minutes. After checking in, I was given room 111. This is the best room there becuause it's the only room with balcony overlooking the canal. Everything in the hotel works perfectly! The hotel is 3 minutes walk to red light district, 5 minutes walk to Dam Square. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need especially location”
Reviews.Author: Shelly74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break, 11-13 November, for my husband's birthday treat. Ten minutes walk (if that) from Central Station and right in the middle of everything. Had room 115 which was a deluxe room (paid for the upgrade) with a shower and bath and overlooking the canal....perfect! Bed was a kingsize with memory foam matress and oversized pillows. Room very clean and about the size of a normal standard room (which is bigger than the standard rooms in this hotel). Draught from the window kept me awake the first night but heating was on all night the second so slept well. A bit of noise was heard as guests climbed up and down the stairs but nothing you wouldn't expect really. No meals included so went to the Old Quarter for breakfast (full english with a smile!). Definately would recommend this hotel and will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Contemporary Quiet Room Bang In The Centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Kev53335
Reviews.Content: Very smooth & fast check-in and paid prior to arrival so checked in & out with express speed. We were impressed with the room. Very nicely furnished in a grey & white fashion. The room had a double bed (was a small double and a bit too small for a 6"5' man and 5"9' woman but comfy other than that), a flat screen TV and a very very nice shower. Bathroom was small but very nice with a modern feel. Overall, very impressed. There was a nice view of Damrak across the river out of the window but there was a cold draught when the curtains were open. The location of the hotel is brilliant and considering this, it's amazing how little noise you hear from the room. I would definitely recommend staying here and will probably check availability should I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: saidy_lady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 2011, bank holiday weekend, it was my hens. The location was right in the centre of the red light district, which is ideal as it's surrounded by great bars, restaurants, coffee shops. It is just around the corner from the famous Grasshopper pub/restaurant/coffee shop. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from central station and same from Dam Square. The rooms were very clean. Some were very small and ours had a spiral staircase up to the beds, our bathroom was on the lower level w a small seating area. It's a bit of a risk if you are having a few drinks, as I found out, so recommend you change rooms if you are prone to a fall. Staff were very helpful and back of hotel was quiet. If you are facing the front street though it's a bit loud. All in All would recommend this hotel for girls and guys as it's a safe walking distance from most bars and the street is always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here (unless you need to stay in red-light District)”
Reviews.Author: swiss_voyager83
Reviews.Content: Ok so the good part is the hotel is on one of the main red light district streets that is 10 minute walk to Dam Square. The room for 4 people cost 209 euros for 1 night.A bit too much for a 3 star.The room looked nothing like it did on the website. It was a bit quirky on 2 floors (well the beds were on a mezzanine in the attic part). We liked this style. To find our room we took the lift to 3rd floor - however, the room on the 3rd floor was up some very narrow stairs, left, right, up a step and along the narrow corridor. Not easy with 16 kg of luggage! Then the door was broken so had to wait 1 hour for this to be fixed. - missed city tour we booked as a result! - not 3 star quality, 2 star at most - bathroom for a 4 people the size of a shoebox. And I have to say, alarm bells were ringing in terms of health and safety. In case of fire we would have been screwed due to location of room and nearest exit. If you can live with all the above then its an ok hotel. Just not the best 3 star I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: I am new tripadvisor but I stayed in Hotel CC in June 2011. Wow...what a cool trendy hotel. Amsterdam is one of the best cities I have ever been to. This hotel was well priced and the staff were excellent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: lush2007
Reviews.Content: Me and my my friend booked the small double bedroom for 1 night stay and was highly surprised of what we received for our money. We were both expecting a small room and small bed but was pleasantly surprised when we walked in to have a room with a large double bed a bathroom with both a shower and bath facilities and to top it off a balcony view (the only balcony of the hotel) which was stunning over the canal. Hotel very clean and tidy and staff very friendly and helpful. After our stay our flight was not till the evening so they let us leave our bags in a cupboard to be collected lager so we could walk round the city without having to drag them. We also got soaked from a downpour so they gave us some towels and let us sit in reception before we went to the airport. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel is the step up from the bathroom from the bedroom is not noticeable and myself and my friend stumped our toe on it several times and also the bathroom door hits the bed when u open it but apart from that a lovely stay would highly recommend and the complimentary bottle if wine in a room was a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but rooms were small”
Reviews.Author: Kyles12
Reviews.Content: From the outside, it doesn't look like much but the rooms are lovely! Very modern and clean. I was unfortunately placed in a basement room which was dark and stuffy. I'd would suggest requesting a room on the first floor or above. Staff were friendly enough. Very central location, can't be faulted there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holly6holly
Reviews.Content: Great Location, but very noisy, clean and tidy but very very small, we had a small double room but I didn't expect it to mean small bed LOL !! it was a large single, we are small people so wasn't to bad, but if you are on the large size get a large double room ! everything you need for somewhere to sleep but take ear plugs the street are very busy all night x would stay again with ear plugs !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, but Fire Safety a Question”
Reviews.Author: TravelPartnerDC
Reviews.Content: Hotel interior room access was confusing with multiple levels and different hallways for each floor (not easy to access with luggage), and narrow stairs and starways that did not always go to the ground floor. Elevator worked well, although slow at times with the number of people using it. In the event of a fire (hotel does have a wood structure), this hotel would be very difficult to exit. In addition, I noticed several fire doors had been wedged open with cardboard pieces under the door, thus defeating thier automatic closure in the event of a fire. Rooms and bathrooms were very nice and functional, AC worked well, rooms were not large, but not to small either. Lighting was a little insufficient in the bathroom and bedroom with it being a little dark for shaving and reading. Two chairs were in the room for sitting. Phone was not adequately marked on how to contact the front desk, but the information was in the book in the room discussing the hotel. There is a charge for the wireless internet in the room of about 6 euro a day, which is a bit high based on the price of the room when other hotels offfer it free. There are two computers in the basement which can be used for free to access the internet for 30 minutes if all you need to do is a quick internet check of email or check in for airlines. If you get a discounted price, the hotel is nice and probably worth the stay as the location for the city center is very good, but if you have to pay full price, other locations may be better. Was some sound from the streets and the windows were not very soundproof, but it was not to annoying. Front desk staff were very nice and courteous and gave me a double room when I had booked a single room because they overbooked the single rooms. Lots of "cafes" in the area and sex shops, so if those things offend you do not want to stay in the City Center area. If arriving by train from the airport (which is quick, easy, and inexpensive) it is a very short walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “The ok corral!”
Reviews.Author: Happyvibe
Reviews.Content: Booked here for one night. It was very clean and had all the mod cons. The downside was the bathroom smelt of drains and there was no breakfast. It is good value for money but I have stayed in much better hotels in Amsterdam. Suffice to say, that it was clean, tidy and very comfortable but I have found better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Caitparedes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of amsterdam. It is close to the red light district but nothing crazy, your a few blocks away from te craziness. Very small ans cozy rooms. Bathroom was very nice, nice shower and clean. Beds were a little to firm and i found some hairs on my bed. Ewww. Kind of skeeved me out. Other that that everything was fine. I dont expect much more with the fair price i got on it. I would recommend it for anyone who doesnt mind a small cozy room

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: PrincesaGaditana
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as it was in the center, for a good deal at booking.com (we didn't pay full price). It is actually on a busy and main street of the Red Light Distric, which I was a little aprehensive about at first, but I needn't had to worry. You don't have to go through dodgy back alleys to get there. It's a block away from the Damrak, Maddam Tussauds' etc. And the station is just around the corner. So very centrally located, and ideal if you want to experience Amsterdam. The hotel itself is great. A bit quircky, due to the stairs and wobbly floors. They have an elevator, but we had to walk the last part to the room (up 2 more tiny stairs) which was fine for us, but can be a pain when carrying heavy luggage. The rooms are modern, just big enough, very clean, great bathroom, great comfortable beds. The hotel had a non-smoking policy, which I appreciated. The only problem was a really loud group waking us up at 4 am, as they decided to have a party in the hall while waiting for someone to get something from the room. But apart from that incident, the hotel is surprisingly quiet, given the busy street it is on. There are vending machines and a mini mart in the lobby, in case you get hungry. Don't forget to grab the mini karts in the lobby before you head into the city, they give you discounts or free gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Great find.”
Reviews.Author: Quinn C
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the Easy Jet website and took the chance. I was so happy with my decision! The hotel spans a couple older buildings so access to the rooms is up multiple staircases. Can be a pain for heavy luggage. The location is great...walking distance to everything you possibly need. The rooms were spotless and very modern. Staff was very accomodating. We switched rooms on the second day because they upgraded us to the top floor. Great view out over the city. Area is full of coffee shops but you're in Amsterdam so we didn't see it as a big issue. I highly recommend and will return soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing...choose another location”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive marketing description, I thought we would get a medium to higher end hotel experience very much in the center of things. Unfortunately that wasn't the case. The hotel was dirty, and very noisy. Music pounding through the walls of our first floor room. And smell of hash coming from multiple rooms and vent in bathroom. Hotel staff was not very helpful. We arrived early, but they made a big deal of not being able to guarantee that our luggage would be stored securely, so we had to lug it around our first day off the train. And then, they didn't even have a map of the area handy , nor did they have any recommendations for restaurants. There are so many nice smaller hotels and B&B's i would recommend. But for CC, take a pass - you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, fab location...highly recomend.”
Reviews.Author: BabyjayneLiverpool
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the heart of Amsterdam...you will not be disappointed at all. It is the road in the middle of Dam Rack and the red light district so a prime location. It backs on to the canal area for the canal tours and I can highly rec the cheese and wine tour. I will return to Amsterdam and will stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly formed rooms in the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: leemabey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Amsterdam Pride weekend. The hotel is situated on a busy street with plenty of coffee shops, delis and sex shops. The reception was very welcoming although my luggage was left in a kitchen area that didn't seem to be all that secure. The hotel itself was quite warm but the room had fantastic air conditioning. The booking said the room was small and they weren't lying but it reallty didn't matter. The hotel had made the most of the space with plenty of original features and a very modern bathroom. The room looked out over Damrak and really added to the character. Even though it is in a very busy area of the city, it was extremely quiet. I definitely got a good night's sleep. There was also mood lighting that was a nice feature and added to the ambience. Although some people have criticised the size of the rooms, you are more than informed of this at the time of booking. Amsterdam is such an amazing city you don't want to spend much time in the hotel so why worry about the size of the room? It is quite expensive compared to similar hotels in other cities, but this is indicitive of the city. I would definitelty stay here again although I don't know if you could share the room with someone else - definitely one for solo travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Right where you want to be...”
Reviews.Author: ZCMC
Reviews.Content: Located in the heat of Amsterdam, near central station, the red light district, the canals, and so much more. The rooms are small but comfortable. The hotel itself is modern with a minimalistic touch and feel. They have a small cafe near the lobby which offers snack and beverages. Easy, affordable, and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, with a very central location”
Reviews.Author: russelljames91
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for 3 nights at the very last minute from ebookers. Compared to most hotels on the street and in the area, this most definitely is the highest standard one available. Within the area are many coffee shops, sex shops very close by and the red light district is only a stones throw away, so if you are wishing to avoid this scene, this hotel is not for you. But if you do, or don't mind being in the area, this place is perfect. The hotel is very central, only about 5 minutes walk away from Centraal Station (at most). Also within 5 minutes in the opposite direction is Dam Square. So on location, this hotel really cannot be beaten! When we checked in we were welcomed by a rather abrupt male receptionist, with whom we were not impressed with. However, every single other receptionist and staff member in the hotel had been beyond friendly and helpful, always smiling and greeting the guests as well as being as helpful and as informative as possible. The hotel is rather new, it seems, as the rooms are very modern. They might be considered a bit small by some people, and it does lack space to keep your suitcase but this is an each to their own type situation. The toilet and shower room is kept very clean with one of the nicest showers i have ever used in it. There was also a widescreen TV in the room with a good selection of channels too. The bed was very comfortable and I had a great sleep in it. The room, despite the location in a rather buzzing part of Amsterdam, was quiet and we were never disturbed by outside noise! There was wireless internet in the room, but considering the room cost in excess of â‚¬100 a night (for us anyway), a charge for usage of WIFI shouldn't be in place. â‚¬15 for 24 hours, if I remember correctly. The hotel did however had two PC's for internet usage in the basement as well as two fridges and a microwave for guests to purchase food and drinks. Very good idea! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, boutique style but rooms a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Jayne1975_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel CC for 3 days in February, booked via late rooms.com. Two of us stayed at the Hotel, Very friendly welcome super clean and modern reception. On entering our room very clean, modern decor very small though but has all the facilities. Adequate bathroom for two people. Located in the main heart of the red light district and plenty of bars and cafes close by, check out Hunters bar opposite the hotel. Good features of the hotel are: Central location 24 hour reception clean and uncluttered friendly staff Modern decor Safe in room Good bathroom Very comfortable bed memory foam mattress Flat panel TV Down side is that there needs to be a fridge in the room, local area is expensive so take plenty of snacks to your hotel room, A tip would be don't get a taxi from the airport as it costs about 45 euros one way catch the train to central station for around 4 euros just round the back of the hotel 2 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: Africa_Travels
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked the CC for a two night business stay in Amsterdam. That was a bit of a mistake. The hotel is right in the entertainment district. The road is closed in the evenings so you have to carry your luggage through the crowds. When I arrived the reception was totally chaotic as it was being rebuild and lots of customers needed attention with no system to help them. Guess renovations happen so it was a bad day. The chap checking me in gave me some free drinks because of the hassle. Finally in the room it was actually ok. My room was to the back so it was quiet, with good ac, nice bed, good shower and so on. So the room itself was not an issue for me. There is no restaurant, just a sort of help yourself bar with sandwiches and drinks. Guess I just booked the wrong hotel for the trip. Definitely not a business hotel or a romantic getaway. If you want to be right in the heart of the party with a decent place to sleep this is for you. Bars, restaurants, coffee shops and the red light district are just there so the area definitely has atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “lovely city hotel in the middle of all the fun!”
Reviews.Author: skieveryday
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & excellent location just max. 5 minutes from central station (We could see the station from our room). Rooms are small, but very modern, clean & comfortable. It was our first wedding anniversary, so perhaps we were upgraded to a quieter room located a the rear of the building, although we did pay more for the best rooms - only get what you pay for! We never heard any noise whatsoever, although I could imagine the front rooms could be less quieter. Our room was on 2 floors with a VERY steep staircase! Made for lots of fun. Lovely cobbled street outside the front of the hotel with bars, restaurants & all sorts of 'Amsterdam' shops! The famous red light district on your very doorstep. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Prema_Sun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this small friendly boutique hotel for two nights in June. The hotel is bang in the red light district and is fantastically located only 5 mins walk from Centraal Station so great in terms of getting from and to Schiphol airport and navigating around the city centre. Not within easy walking distance of the museum quarter (for those interested in the museums); a tram would be needed (nos. 2 or 5) from the station. Booked a standard double room. Compact indeed they are, but v clean and quirky. Beware - the first night I was given room 201 which was right next to the lift, which was noisy all night! Ear plugs were a life saver. Requested a quiet room if possible at the time of booking but there are never any guarantees this can be carried out so didn't create a song and dance about this to hotel staff. The 2nd night I was moved to 316 which was a lovely room overlooking the water but the room sloped (the whole building might slope) and the door to this room had a substantial gap cut away from it at the bottom so it could close! The sound proofing therefore wasn't great here either when other residents were hovering, entering and leaving neighbouring rooms on the same floor. On a huge plus side, the hotel staff were extremely friendly, professional and accommodating and did their best to resolve the problem with the room. The hotel was completely full the first night so I couldn't move to another standard double room and upgrading to a bigger room would have been another 100 euros per night which I opted not to do. Overall, sound proofing aside, this was a convenient, clean hotel to stay in for a couple of nights. I would rate it 'fair' in a category of small contemporary boutique hotels. PS London June 2011

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean but small rooms. Good value. Not quiet.”
Reviews.Author: SolLight
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a five minute walk from central station. Good value for the price. There is no restaurant or bar. You can leave your bags but it is just a locked closet and you get no claim ticket. Right next to Red Light District. Clean rooms. The location is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “clean and tiny”
Reviews.Author: DMS888
Reviews.Content: A very clever use of space. The rooms looked great and were clean but they are tiny - really small! If you are going to get battered with friends it's fine as it's close to the touristy areas but if you are a light sleeper avoid it. The windows are very thin and the road is noisy until the early hours. Staff are nice too. There is wifi now but it's 10 euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great for partying!”
Reviews.Author: NolaMomma
Reviews.Content: My family & I had 2 rooms here & were amazed at how expensive it is! The location is excellent & the views are also great but the rooms are tiny & the hotel is poorly equipped. There is no wifi, our shower didn't drain, our bathroom door didn't open fully (because the bed was so close), it reeked of pot in the rooms & the hotel was super noisy all night long. If you're looking for a central location to crash in after hardcore partying, this is the place for you...if you want a retreat from the lively Amsterdam atmosphere, look elsewhere for this price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish, clean, top value”
Reviews.Author: hawkinspete
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel near Centraal Station but didn't want to spend too much so selected this place. It was about 10 minutes walk from the station, right on the edge of the Red Light District, 'coffee shop' zone. I was expecting something like a hostel, which is the standard type of accommodation in this area. However it was actually a really nice designer / boutique hotel. Looked very new. The room allocated was stylish, clean, with all comforts incl flat-screen, tea & coffee facilities, and a vast stack of pillows. Lovely en-suite bathroom. Good air-con. I requested a 'small double' and it was indeed quite small. However it was perfectly adequate - quite cosy like a cabin in a ship. Other reviews mentioned that not all rooms reachable by lift. Since I had heavy luggage I made sure to request a room near an elevator so this was not an issue. The location is great. Although on the edge of the RLD this area is quite safe (but be aware of what to expect of the area as some travelers may feel uncomfortable - none I know personally though). Many touristic attractions nearby e.g., Dam Square area, canal-cruise docks. There are tram stops nearby for sights further afield. There is no restaurant (there is a 24 hour vending area) but there are numerous restaurants and bars nearby. Only negative I can think of was that WiFi was not free. I think these days this people expect WiFi to be free and that's the only reason I'm marking down value a bit. There were a couple of free internet PCs in the basement, and Amsterdam is full of free WiFi hotspots anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & Clean 10/10!”
Reviews.Author: mel748
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights. We were really happy with our standard double room. It was so clean and the bed was super comfortable and big. There was no Wifi in the room but there were 2 free computers to use downstairs & printing was free! The staff on the reception were really helpful and gave their Aussie tourists some good tips and advice. We were in close proximity to Dam Square & the station & were very close to the red light district, no more than 5 mins walk to each of these. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: yamnala
Reviews.Content: i stayed her in february and other than the rain it was a lovely stay. i didnt find the hotel too easy but it was in the perfect location in the town centreon the street Warmoesstraat straight across from hunters bar( coffee shop), i had booked a large double for an extra fee and requested a bath and only got the room as this was the only room with a bath as standard, when i arrived they were very friendly and were aware of my request but we could not check in at the time we were assured that our room would be ready soon enough, when we arrived back we were checked into our room to see that it was a small double with no bath so i went back down to reception to complain at first i was told there was nothing they could do and after a few mins of complaining i was given another room which was definitly a large double compared to the last room with a large bathroom with a bath and seperate shower, very nice room with everything you could need spotless clean very comfortable bed, awful view looking out on to the air condtioning unit which was a bit noisey but didnt bother me, they do not have a resturant but have fridges of food like yogarts sanwiches subs and drinks that you can buy and microwave to use, its not a hotel that you will have great atmosphere in but its so clean and comfortable at a good price its hard to find this in the city centre, if i was going back i would definitly stay here quiet clean and comfy all you need!! go to the amsterdam dungeons very good and so funny!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel in a brilliant location with clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: wolfpackmember
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of April and had a great time. Everything about this place - the location, the cleanliness, the staff were all top drawer however the only thing to bring this down having been there is the cost. Not very competitive and small double room is really small!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location would stay again”
Reviews.Author: KentJig
Reviews.Content: Service we experienced was fine, didnâ€™t need anything so no problems there. Went with boyfriend and got there early, we were able to leave our bags there and check in later. rooms were small but clean room i stayed in was quite quirky . I took a risk from reading the reviews as i like my hotels to be very clean and luxurious however due to budget it was not possible this time. The location was EXCELLENT. Right in the middle of everything, coffee shops, bars and places to get food. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel and pop back in the afternoon. Red light district 10 min walk away as is train station. We were able to walk to the anne frank house and around Amsterdam. I donâ€™t like walking anywhere and this location was so convenient and close to everything. Hotel cc is clean and a good hotel to stay in, the only one issue i had was the noise from the street. If you are a light sleeper then ask for a room at the back as my room was facing on to the street and people were shouting till the very early hours. This is was not a problem for us as we were drunk so didnâ€™t hear it as much. If you can handle the noise from the street then this is the place to stay and if not have a smoke and drink and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel To Explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Paul4As
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel because it was a decent price and the location. 5-10 minute walk from the train station, right beside the red light district, 10 minute walk to the Dam Square and the palace...the hotel can't be beaten for where it is!!! Room was clean and modern with an air conditioning unit. It was split in to two levels with very steep steps up to the bedroom....fine for us thirty somethings who watched what we drank each night!!! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel...we frequented a small cafe called Teddy's Corner just across the road all 3 mornings...nice wee spot!!! English fry on offer as well as just the basic tea and toast. The hotel for us was basically a room for us to sleep in and get changed...quiet, no hassle, friendly reception staff. The street on which the hotel is located has plenty of bars and cafes...we hit the two Irish ones Durty Nellys and Irish Pub Slainte for grub...decent enough prices compared to other places! Speaking of prices...I ran out of money in a bar...cost of alcohol in Amsterdam is shocking...though do "shop around"...we saved 4 euros on two drinks between two bars which were around the corner from one another. We did the 1 hour canal trip with the Lovers company, we visited Ann Frank's house (pre-book online to save you queuing...even at 6:30pm on a Sunday night there were loads of people, who we by-passed, waiting to get in!!!), we went to Casa Rosso for their live adult shows (not seedy at all, plenty of couples and females at 11pm on a Friday evening), we people watched at Dam Square, we explored the Red Light District at night which has to be seen to be believed!!!...perfect weather when we were there added to the ambiance!!! Overall Amsterdam was class and the CC Hotel was the perfect base!!! Definitely would stay here again or recommend friends to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Weird - not really a hotel - just rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Tourist17
Reviews.Content: I travelled wirh seven colleagues - we wanted a central hotel near the station. As we discovered Hotel CC is located on a narrow street in the red light district. This street is extremely crowded, noisy and in the morning covered in mess from the night before. Hotel CC is a rabbit warren spread over four floors, there is a lift to the third floor, what is totally confusing is that your room maybe on the third floor but having left the lift, to get to it ,you may well go up and down a series of narrow and in some cases very steep stairs. None of us managed to find the stairs from the first floor to the lobby. The first room I was allocated was on the top floor under the eaves the only area where I could stand up straight was in a strip down the centre about 4 feet wide.In fairness on complaining I was allocated another room at the back of the hotel which was much better. The decor in the rooms is good cool whites and greys, the bathrooms are all fitted out to a high standard, in room facilities are also good including high quality towels etc. All my colleagues were amazed at the sizes of the bedrooms & bathrooms - they are diminutive!!! There are only 3 hooks in the rooms to hang jackets - no wardrobes The beds are also exceptionally short. There is no provision for breakfast. The only staff we saw was one person on reception. At â‚¬175 for the night it was lousy value. If you and your partner are 5ft tall, very slim and aged 25 or under and keen to be in the redlight district this could be ideal for you - all others avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment of the Year”
Reviews.Author: MyTravels011
Reviews.Content: I am going in on my second day at Hotel CC and this has to be the most disappointing decision that I have made in a long time. I am also starting to question the validity of reading reviews. So many people raved about the wonderful location. But I guess everyone looks for something different. If you are looking to be in the middle of the red light district and party it up tourist style--this would be just the place for you. If you are looking to be a nice and convenient location, but quiet and closer to galleries and shops than prostitutes and coffee shops, then this may not be it. Oh yes, and ladies--be prepared to hear a few cat calls on your way home at night. So now that I got the location out of the way, now to the rooms. If you want to live college dormitory style in a room the size of a matchbox---the Hotel CC is the place for you. Never have I seen a place so small and considered a viable hotel room. What is going for over 140 Euros online should really be offered for 40 Euros --just for offering closets as rooms. The images on the site should seriously come with dimensions so you know what you're getting into. On a rate of 1-10, this place gets at 2.5. Points go to friendly staff and somewhat clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel CC Despite review a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: finni
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and fitted all our requirements. Yes the rooms are small but this is the same all over amsterdam. The rooms were clean, tidy and the most comfortable beds after a day sight seeing. Within easy reach of bars etc. Easy to find somewhere for breakfast. Staff at hotel very friendly and eager to help. Would book here again without any worries.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location but some annoyances”
Reviews.Author: travelguru667
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days here, firstly the good: - right by Red Light District lots of coffee shops food stores all around, very close to Centraal Station so location can't be beat - rooms all modern and renovated despite building being old, with modern appliances.. lots of small hotels on this street but I think this one has the most modern look - night staff always friendly.. especially the few guys of east-asian descent - laundromat a few doors down so that's a plus - room has a safe The bad: - I specifically hung "Do not disturb" sign on the door and yet room was still serviced which was annoying since some of my clothes were moved by housekeeper - not all double rooms are the same.. friend got another double room that faced the street and was very noisy when she had specifically asked for a quiet room - Pakistani guy on morning shift was sleazy towards my friend which was very unprofessional

Reviews.Title: “fabby clean grate staff xxxxxxxxxxx thank you all xxxxx”
Reviews.Author: saskia13
Reviews.Content: just bk from amsterdam and loved it hotel cc was just the best close to all that you need to see .it was so clean the staff were so nice and helpful will be staying there again for sure THANK YOU HOTEL CC YOUR THE BEST XXXXXXXXXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AussieLady_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very clean, prime location, very helpful staff who went to no end of trouble to help me out. Happy to secure your luggage before/after checkout. Single rooms were pretty cute, quaint, and though small they make up for it in charm and cleaniness. Would definitely come back and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loacation, Stlye & Comfort! This hotel has it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loulou96
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel CC and I could not have been more impressed by the location, the service, the cleanliness, the style and the quality of this hotel. Whilst this hotel is right in the midst of the red light district, you are only minutes from Central Station and Dam Square, the back of the hotel faces over the canal that runs along Damrak. We travelled with friends who had a room on the ground floor and we were on the third floor up in the eaves of the hotel, both of our rooms faced into the middle of the hotel so had neither a street or canal view, but this was not a problem. Neither of us had any problems with street noise at all, which was astounding given it was such a busy weekend. We booked through trip advisor and opted for the â€˜Luxuryâ€™ room, and we had a real treat, having read lots of reviews and having been to Amsterdam before we fully expected the rooms to be small, but we actually found our room really well laid out and did not have any problems with the size. We did get a very special room which had a mezzanine level with the bedroom upstairs and a living area and the bathroom downstairs. We loved this room, but the staircase was incredibly steep and treacherous. One thing with this hotel, be sure to take a good note of where your room is, the corridors are like rabbit warrens, with steps up and down and doors to different corridors, the floor is a little wonky like most buildings in Amsterdam and there are beams to further bump your head on. One night we very nearly had to go to reception as we couldnâ€™t find our roomâ€¦.. it seems that at night they close the various doors along the corridor. The bathroom of the hotel was lovely, it was more or less a fully tiled wet room with a rain head shower. No expense has been spared on the quality of the finish throughout. What is particularly nice is that the original beams are still exposed and really work well with the modern finish. The bed and linen was amazing, one of the most comfortable beds I have ever had in a hotel, with 4 huge pillows, a duvet and lovely white bed covers, it was hard to drag ourselves away from it to get up and going in the mornings. The hotel does not have a breakfast service although they do have a vending machine and a selection of drinks, sandwiches, snacks and hot drinks that you can buy fairly reasonably. This was not any sort of problem for us as there were many places to get breakfast right on the doorstep of the hotel. Unfortunately the hotel does not offer free WIFI, it costs â‚¬4 for 1 hour and you need to buy a card from reception, you can buy longer cards if needed, although they do have 2 computers that you can use for free. We luckily discovered that Hunters Bar opposite the hotel offered free WIFI so we would have coffee and drinks in there to make the most of their WIFI (you need to ask them for the password). The hotel does seem to be incredibly popular so check in was not possible before 2pm, although you can leave your luggage with the hotel when you arrive and leave. All in all we were very very impressed with this hotel and will certainly return next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Read This = The real Hotel CC = You get what you pay for! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: RajBansal
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews below, I felt I had to write a short something to let people know what this place is about. OK, firstly yes its in the Red Light but we had a view overlooking Damrak and it was an amazing view, you COULD NOT be closer to the main areas and then a short walk to Dam Square. The rooms and bathrooms all looked brand new and were furnished brilliantly, we had two rooms of 2 and one room of 4 across a number of floors and they were all great. Only issue, stairways are a bit narrow, but thats across Europe they do that, its not a problem! The rooms are perfect. Yes its a bit expensive if you don't book far in advance but for 8 of us for 2 nights it worked out to about Â£100 each, you can go to a hostel for cheaper but when your drinking and socialising in the rooms and wanting to be able to relax on the sofas and watch the flatscreen TVs then you want to be somewhere like here! Some amazing restaurants nearby, Bird Thai being the best. Definitely will come back to stay here in the future. Only a 3 minute walk from the Centraal Station!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think you are getting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis0
Reviews.Content: Althought the CC hotel has a fantastic location, the room we thought we booked did not look like what was featured on their website. Buyer beware. I would have much rather stayed at a hostel in an ensuite. We most definitely over paid for this room. If you are all about location then this place is for you. There are many other hostels or hotels within a short walk to the red light district. Just make sure to do your homework. We will most definitely not stay here again. Plain and simple: FALSE ADVERTISEMENT!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cdjl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel CC mid February and was very impressed with my much researched choice. Located 5 minutes from Central Station, 5 minutes from the Red Light District, 10 minutes from Dam Square and directly on the coffee-shop-strip you could barely be more central to the action. We were greeted with friendly staff who were happy for us to store our bags until check in time. Some exploration of the town later stumbled back to the hotel to check into our room and get ready for the evening. We had booked a small double and i can honestly say i was very impressed with its size. We had a double bed and flat screen tv, with enough storage for our 2 travel cases, and a wardrobe containing approx 10 hangers. It seems that our 'small double' was superior to what some others had experienced. The main draw back to our room was being on the ground floor, right on the roadside with the busy cafes and bars. When i walked in and saw this, i was dreading it. In actuallity the room was peaceful and quiet. It was only used for sleep and the noise levels were perfectly acceptable, and the town seemed to die out not long after we'd finished our night- no partying through the night as we expected. The only bizarre moment was when i opened the curtains (which we kept closed) and found someone leaning against our window from the street. However he was talking on his phone and at this close proximity i couldnt hear a word, so this can only be a positive... right? Anyway back to the clean, tidy, modern room. It was impressively comfortable with a top notch shower/bathroom. We left the hotel for dinner and enjoyed one of the many choices on our doorstep, followed by plenty of bars down this very same strip. Perfect after a day of lots of walking around the beautiful amsterdamian streets and canals. I would highly recomend this stay. The only improvement i would suggest is when you leave your luggage. The staff are happy to store your bags before or after your check in, however there is no form of receipt or ticketing system meaning that anybody could walk in off the street and say they left their luggage. They will be taken to the storage room and can take their pick of any bags they choose- an accident waiting to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Gibbo_101
Reviews.Content: The title says it all really. Yes, the rooms are small (Opt for an upgrade if that important to you), but for me, more importantly they are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. On the other hand, if you've brought your cat to swing around the room, then yes, you'll have a problem. Otherwise, get out and enjoy the great location that it resides in. I.e. The middle of Amsterdam. The staff were both friendly and professional during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy little hotel...recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Minus_Kitty
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the CC hotel for 2 nights in December. Location is pretty much perfect if you want to be in the middle of the action. Only 10mins walk from Central Station. The Red Light district is literally round a corner from here. The hotel is located on a street with countless bars, coffeeshops and food establishments so plenty of things right on your doorstep. We stayed in a small double, and as stated the room was very small. Not uncomfortably so though, we had one of the back rooms overlooking the Damrak so quite quiet at night. The hotel room was very comfortable and clean. It's a fairly new hotel and it shows. The shower in the bathroom was amazing. The staff at reception were very friendly, and were very helpful with regards to some queries we had. Probably one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room in World!”
Reviews.Author: Shel77
Reviews.Content: OK - no review is gonna prepare you for how small these rooms are. I had read the reviews but was still shocked. Basically you are staying in the equivalent to a SMALL cabin on a boat. Yes, it's that small. Two people cannot stand up at the same time. There is nowhere for your luggage or to hang your clothes (you only get 2 hangers and a very small space). Our room overlooked the canal and maybe thats why it was damp all the time - damp on the walls and you could feel it in the air. The heating system was noisy so you couldn't have it on at night but then it got really cold. The bathroom, while small, was really clean and functional and I have no real complaints about it other than it could have been a tiny bit bigger so you could brush your teeth at the sink without having to open the door to give yourself more room. The hotel's location really depends on what you want from Amsterdam. Be warned...contrary to other reviews it is not outside the red light district. It's slap bang in the middle. We got a bit of a shock with that one! In saying that it is close to most things. Dam Square is only a 10 min walk as is the central station. It helps to be in a handy location when you are in a big city like Amsterdam. The street was full of coffee shops (you know the ones I mean) but there was no trouble and because we were on other side of hotel we didn't get the noise from the street. Not sure I would receommend this. Just too small and damp. I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Modern, Staff could do a bit better.”
Reviews.Author: ChrWal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days and had a good stay! The room was warm and cosy and had the funkiest bathroom with a massive walk in power shower! Bed was soft and the room was very clean and modern. The hotel was in a great location and was very easy to find, loads of nice restaurants within walking distance as well as being close to the central station and lots of attractions. The only downside was the staff. When I arrived at 2, which was when I was told I could check in, the man on reception told me the room wasnt ready and to come back at 4. He told me I couldnt wait at the hotel and couldnt leave my case! A couple of the staff were a bit unfriendly and couldnt even muster up a "Good Morning"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cathydaniel
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two night stay at Hotel CC. Really good hotel and in a great location in Amsterdam. Perfectly central for making the most of a short stay in the city. We booked a double room and it was lovely looking out on to the canal. The only complaint I have is that it was a small bit noisy at night but to be expected really given it's proximity to the red light district. The room was very small but clean and modern. The bathroom was really nice and had a lovely shower. I would definitely stay here again as the hotel is within walking distance of the train station and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with quiet rooms considering located near Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: RG_Perth
Reviews.Content: This hotel should really be considered part of the Red Light District and may not be suitable for people with children, however was great value for money and very modern and spacious. We booked the extra large/deluxe room as we had read many other reviews advising that the rooms were small, and were very happy with the room size. The rooms were very comfortable, with the only issue being that the shower flooded a little because of the 'modern' shower screen that wasn't actually wide enough to keep the water in. Wi fi is available, however charged at 15 euro ffor 2 days. Location wise, the hotel was an easy walk to the Amsterdam Centraal train station, plus many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: pilsen_pete
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay in the middle of Amsterdam. Our room was small, but really nice and comfortable. It's a walking distance to the train station and tons of bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “nice but needs attention”
Reviews.Author: lauren_bailey23
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via the late rooms website and paid a total of 289 euros. Prior to our trip we read mixed reviews and so were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. One major downside is that the rooms are VERY small, the size of a box room in some cases. Our double room barely fitted us and our suitcase inside! However, it was of modern decor and was clean on arrival. The bathroom was much nicer, although the toilet and sink were in an odd position making sitting on the toilet very awkward! The shower was lovely, very warm and powerful. The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels and tea/coffee making provided. Only one spoon though. The reception staff were very friendly and welcomed us to the hotel every time they saw us. Our room (219) had brown masking tape over a ventilation duct and a nail sticking out of the floor! Not ideal. The location is great if you want to be near to the red light district and a wide choice of coffee shops. Not for those who wish to avoid this "seedier" side to Amsterdam. We walked to all attractions without any difficulty. Amsterdam proved to be very expensive (14 euro for the van gogh museum, 19 euro for the zoo) so be prepared to spend to see the sights. Overall we felt the hotel was of sound quality for the price we paid, however this was a discounted price! Amsterdam itself is a good getaway for a weekend but a downside is the price for museums if you are on a budget. We enjoyed the red light district- very bizarre but entertaining. Coffee shops vary in price so make sure you check out a few to see which are cheap. number 36 a few doors up from the hotel was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and generally unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: ducheau
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and am glad it was only one night. When I arrived I was given a hot 8 X8 room just above the reception area with no opening windows. This was not going to work so I returned to the reception desk and was informed that the only other room they could give me was a single facing the street. I was a bit hesitant about accepting it because of the noise, but the receptionist assured me that it wouldn't be that bad. Boy was he wrong. From 10pm until probably close to 4 in the morning you could hear constant street noise, people yelling, motor cycles roaring by, it was really awful. I got almost no sleep. Had I known it would of been this loud and the receptionist had truthful I would of left. But of course he was more interested in the money than the comfort of a guest. The room itself was for the most part clean, but the bathroom stunk of sewage. This was probably one of the worst hotels experiences I have ever had. Avoid this place at all costs. You're better off sleeping on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for My Needs”
Reviews.Author: ajpeters
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to crash on a self-imposed 26-hour layover between two long flights. My goal was to see a bit of Amsterdam, crash for a few hours then easily make it to the airport in the morning. The CC is less then half a kilometer fromAmsterdam Centraal Station. so getting to the hotel was a breeze (the train from the airport was easy and cheap). The CC sits next to canals, is in the middle of the coffeehouse district, near the red light district and a was a reasonable walk to the museum district so it was perfect for getting a quick taste of all the things that make Amsterdam a tourist hot spot. I got a standard double which was about as small as I expected from the other reviews. It was a squeeze to move about the room with my two suitcases and garment bag. If I wanted to open my clamshell style suitcase I had to lay it on the bed. That said, the room was clean, the linens were clean, the water was readily adjustable hot and cold and it was quiet for the most part. I did have some rowdy revelers making noise rousing one of their friends a couple doors down at 3AM. I was also near the stairs which are wooden and a bit loud at times. Overall, for 60 euro, I got a reasonable place to rest, see the sights and get back on the road. I wouldn't bring the kids or stay there on business. I would stay there again for a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Spaghettigue
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the New Year and found the hotel was within easy walking distance to all the attractions. The hotel was both clean and bright even though we had an 'inside room'. The staff all spoke fantastic English and were all extremely friendly and welcoming. Would definitely recommend due to locality.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: faith007
Reviews.Content: We paid for a small room, but got an extra large one, with a view to a canal, georgeous! Modern and clean, super comfortable beds, huge bathroom, with both a shower and a bath (ask for a heater if cold! there are no radiators in the bathroom! could be an issue in the winter...) In the centre, close to the train/bus station, I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rigby44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel CC for three nights in early November 2010 and thought it was very good indeed. The rooms themselves are fairly small but what they lack in size they make up for in modern decor, cleanliness and comfort. The heart of Amsterdam location is ideal and its very much value for money. We had a problem one night where our key card failed and wouldn't let us into the room, the manager was called at once and arrived at the hotel within 20 minutes, we were given free food whilst we waited and I was impressed with how the issue was handled. Would reccomended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located 5-7min walk from Central Station.”
Reviews.Author: Mochmon
Reviews.Content: Hotel CC located right on the touristy Warmoesstraat great for those travellers looking for the bright light and shopping or even culture vultures or both.... The positives The standard of cleanliness was excellent not only in the rooms, but also the reception and corridors. I found my room to be very quiet, however I stayed in one of those rooms in the middle of the building stairing at the neighbours, so no street noises. The shower was a proper power jobby and the standard of fixture and finish was excellent. The paint was clean and fresh and finished in cool contemparary colours. The negatives. There is NO wardrobe to hang your clothes the hotel provide you with four hangers which is a token gesture. (you cannot hang your own in it either) so my clothes hung in the bathroom for the duration of my stay!! The size of the rooms were compact and bijou and could be a problem for some people. And finaly please provide more sugar, milk and coffee in the room........ Would I recommend it anyone else? yes for the central location and cleanliness and if your travelling solo...

Reviews.Title: “Smart, great location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: gwenbo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, right by the central station and the red light district. I was lucky enough to have a room facing the water on the ground floor - literally 3foot above the water! A bit noisy at night, but fine. Room was tiny - literally enough room for a single bed and no wardrobe. But decent sized bathroom and really all you need. Very smart fittings and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: minime22
Reviews.Content: A hotel in the centre of Amsterdam, close to everything. The rates are good and the staff are friendly, rooms very clean and modern. I'm a light sleeper but i slept well to say we were in the centre surrounded by all the action!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Scev
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Yes, the rooms are on the small side but for a couple, very cosy. Comfortable bed, great shower and the whole place is really clean. Reception staff are friendly and helpful. We bought bread, cheese etc from a nearby supermarket and ate breakfast in the little room downstairs overlooking the canal. Nice little Italian restaurant right next door too!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected --- fabulous location NEAR the action (but not IN it)”
Reviews.Author: lovelofi
Reviews.Content: Gotta say ---- wasn't too excited about this hotel prior to arrival based on some reviews, but after some searching...the price sold us. And, I'll say up front...this hotel deserves the 3.5 rating currently achieved via TripAdvisor, as I'm up for putting down a bet on very few hotels @ ~$150 (U.S.)/night getting a 3 or higher. In general, (from reading reviews and our onsite confirmation) rooms at all levels are expensive and boarder on crappy in Amsterdam. So, on to the review... It was our first time in Europe, so it wasn't super easy to find the place...but that's more to do with OUR lack of preparation. In any event, one of the first lessons learned in Europe was front doors (and initial appearance) are often deceiving. From the outside, and partially because of the cramped / sterile reception area....I thought we'd made a mistake. But, the room was small, tidy, and basic...other than the crazy 'loft' area for our bed. The staircase went like straight up (and I mean straight --- nearly 90 degrees) to the loft!! Quite a challenge in the middle of the night to use the toilet, but we managed. :) Another small aspect is the 'bravery' of a hotel choosing black carpet....while it might 'cover' some things...it also makes every tiny little fleck of lint visible. In short, I applaud the CC for keeping the black carpet pristine...in the hallways and our room! The bed itself was really quite nice....one of the nicest of our trip. The bathroom was small but functional (just like the room). However, our towels had a funky odor. They were clean, but sorta left us smelling faintly like...garlic? We didn't complain, as it seemed trivial. However, it was not the nicest part of our experience in the room. Oh, one amenity that I didn't realize was one until the end of our trip was having a hot water maker in the room for instant coffee and tea. Ours was a little grubby on the outside, but was clean enough. And, as it turns out, having a spot of tea before you leave your room in Europe is not exactly the norm. In all other hotels, we could get tea (just one cup of hot water and a bag of Lipton - yuck) for about $4 (U.S.) in the lobby. :( At night, we did not hear any street noise, but you can hear people getting in and out of their rooms...we could hear people in other rooms around us shuffling around and whatnot, but it turned out all of our hotels in Europe had that problem...you could hear noise from the hallways and movement of other people in other rooms. But, I give this a shoulder shrug in retrospect. The hotel is centrally located (pretty close to Central Station --- certainly walkable) and on one of the super touristy (BUSY) streets near (not in --- as some other reviews state) the Red Light District. Thus said, just a couple turns and you'll be fully exposed to some nearly-naked gals in windows...so don't be too shocked if you're trying to avoid that type of thing. (There are plenty of OTHER touristy/fun locations in Amsterdam, so choose your lodging accordingly.) Upon arrival, the staff wasn't rude, but sorta didn't really care that we were there. As they started to check us in, the staff had side conversations with each other, took phone call(s), and generally took their sweet time getting us checked in. Oh well.
