The gentleman was very nice about escorting us to our room via elevator....recommended for hauling luggage most of the way to the room only...should plan to use the steep and narrow stairs for most other journeys to/from your room. Those that complain the lift didn't get them all the way to the doorstep of their room should be aware than just about any hotel under $250-300/night in AMS is HIGHLY unlikely to have an elevator at all....just throwing that out there for the ungrateful. (We stayed two additional nights in AMS at the end of our trip in a similar accommodation without an any elevator at all....the CC spoiled us.) Overall, this was a great stay in a 3 Star Hotel (not talkin the Ritz here...3 Stars it is). I would highly recommend to friends, but maybe not relatives (if that makes any sense)? For the price and location, I certainly would not hesitate to stay here again. P.S. If you're into locally brewed beer, do not miss out on the brewery/restaurant (sign is shaped like a yellow and blue raindrop) that's just up the street a little ways. We spent 5 days in Belgium, and ended up liking one of their brews better than most of those in Belgium...I think the beer was called Willike...or something like that??? I know it was a Wit beer....do not miss (if you like that sorta thing). Here's to supporting your local brewers!!

Reviews.Title: “3 days in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: baboonski
Reviews.Content: I was kinda scared of location of hotel CC, couse he's located in centre of weed en sex district :P . I went calm as soon as i saw it. Everywhere on streets are monitorings and police officers. Hotel was modern and clean. Nice view from windows and lovely location. From there every tourist attraction was close. Bad thing was.. no warming up. And weird part: building [ i think like every building in amsterdam] was ... crooked? U could feel it, that you're walking on not straight floor.

Reviews.Title: “Never again !!!!”
Reviews.Author: dolcon
Reviews.Content: The elevator does not go to all levels . We had to carry our suit cases up the stairs. It was quite noisy in the hotel after midnight when all the youngsters returned from their outings . Pillows were not at all comfortable (very synthetic). We were mislead by the description " Boutique Hotel". It was far too expensive for what was offered. The receptionists were very helpful. The double room was quite small for 2 but clean. We did not like the location at all. We might have liked it if we were younger !!!

Reviews.Title: “little, nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Aljono4ka
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel just 50 meters from Red Lights, on the one of the busiest streets in Amsterdam, we got a room on the ground floor facing the street and I thought that it would not possible to get any sleep there, however there is no nightlife on that street after 1 am, so I had no problems sleeping at nights :-))) the staff is very friendly and helpful, big thanks to them with helping us to find a relatively cheap parking for our car:-))) (yepp, we should have taking bicycles, not the CAR :-)))))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Location, Price and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Ross786
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed at this hotel in the 3rd week of September for 2 nights for the purpose of a weekend getaway / stag-do. We booked via travelrepublic uk and got a great deal. For 4 of us it worked out at Â£48 per person per night which considering the location, quality and service, was fantastic. The location is approx 25 mins from the airport and cost 42 euros. Some of the street is pedestrianised so we were dropped near to the hotel by the taxi and walked part of the way which was fine. The hotel itself is smack back in the middle of a very atmospheric area which borders the main core of the red light district. Coffeeshops, restaurants, take-aways, bars and touristic shops are in the immediate vicinity around the hotel and this makes for a vibrant stay. The hotel itself has had a total renovation making it clean, sharp and modern. We were initially situated in the 'double special' rooms and these were extremely snug lets say! Following a breif chat with the guy on reception, he very kindly relocated us into twin rooms which had exponentially more room. He did this at no extra cost and even had our luggage relocated by the time we got back from our trip out that day. A very friendly, approachable and flexible service at reception. Excellent customer service. The rooms themselves are very clean, modern and inviting. Bathrooms are economically sized but this is typical for Amsterdam buildings of this type and besides, for the price, its right on the money. Whether you are planning a romantic weekend getaway with your other half or a party break for a group of friends, this hotel is ideally placed to fill your needs. They have free internet PC's too. Not sure about wireless though. We had a great time there and its geographic position for touristic spots , transportation routes, entertainment and lifestyle is spot-on. Ignore any bad reviews , this really is a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: red kop
Reviews.Content: just returned after staying 2 nites at the cc,although as i stated the rooms are on the small side,the beds are the most comfortable i have used on my many travel,also a great walk in shower,the location is also perfect..would only recommend for a short stay,as the rooms are built for relaxing in....one more thing if you stay at this hotel there is a fantastic bar called hunters across the road,best bar i have been in for a long time,we were made welcome from the moment we walked in!!1

Reviews.Title: “modern, adequate, and the best location!”
Reviews.Author: catdoodes
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a long weekend stay at the hotel cc in amsterdam, and we want to go back! the best bit about the hotel was the location! - smack bang in the middle of everything so its all walking distance, but suprisingly it wasnt that noisey on the main street so we could have a good lay in! some of the rooms back onto a nice waterway, ,but ours didnt as we had a standard room. you could see this view though frokm the downstais communal area. the hotel rooms were a little small, but it was definately enough to swing a small cat, so i wouldnt complain. the rooms do make up for the space though, as they are very modern and trendy, so i felt like i was in a much more expensive hotel! the hotel also had 24hour snack bar thing that sells alcohol and doghnuts! mmmm. downstairs they have nice eating area, and free internet access on 2 computiers! this was great, though only drawback was that we tried not to let others look at our screen as they passed, though it was generally a nice quite private area. the reception staff are friendly and laid back. they did not charge us for local calls either, and are really relaxed about inviting 'visitors' back to your room (if your into that sort of thing!). overall though, we thought is was excellent value for money and the best location and lovely hotel. would definately come back to same hotel in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it's worth the price”
Reviews.Author: giuliamaltea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Warmoesstraat, in the Red Light district, a popular tourist street lined with pubs and coffeeshops and leading to the Dam. The rooms are simply decorated but clean. Front desk staff was not too helpful. There are some vending machines outside the hall selling cold beverages. Great location, but a bit pricey for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: aideenx
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends stayed here for two nights in March. We were very pleasantly surprised by what we found! Yes the rooms are small but they are clean, have all mod cons, the beds are very comfortable and in my opinion the rooms are perfectly adequate.. The location is perfect, I cannot stress this enough. We were there for a fun weekend and this hotel is right in the middle of all the fun. You are right on one of the dams main streets so beware if its a quite relaxing weekend your going for this is not the hotel for you! The red light district is one street over, the cafes are on your doorstep, the train station is a five minute walk away and Dam Square is about three minutes away. If your looking for a hotel that is close to everything and comfortable then this is the one! I'm about to book a second stay here for this September.

Reviews.Title: “Too close for comfort!!”
Reviews.Author: lakersgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good price and good location if you don't mind being RIGHT in the center of the red light district and most touristy coffee and sex shops. Depending on what kind of trip you are looking to take this may not be right for you. I felt like I was at a frat party for 3 days straight. And don't even think of walking the streets in the morning when they spray them down! They are filthy! If I did my trip over I would stay the other side of Amsterdam where it is cleaner and more quaint.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: suzderek
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel cc 9th-11th July had a wonderful stay the hotel is in a great location in the heart of the town. the hotel is beautiful trendy very very clean & very secure. my BF and me had no problems at all the man on reception was so nice upgraded us wen we arrived id reccomend this holet to any from single traveller couples & families beds were extra comfortable too

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms plus the annoying smell of marijuana”
Reviews.Author: Jet9
Reviews.Content: I had an "Extra large deluxe double": 1. You can touch both opposite walls of the room when you stretch your arms! 2 . You need to bend your body to fit into the smallest shower cabin I ever saw in my life. 3. Any airplane lavatory appears gigantic compared to what you find at the CC hotel. Besides the extreme small dimensions of the rooms: 4. The hotel is located within a pedestrian zone. There is no way to get there by car, not even by taxi. There are quite many "coffee shops" very close to the hotel and you smell the typical odor of marihuana in the entire hotel and of course in your room quite intensively. Comparing the price you pay at CC Hotel to other hotels in Amsterdam, the CC hotel is not a value choice at all. I left the hotel after the first night and stayed at a much better hotel for Euros 40 less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for short visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mrboajangles
Reviews.Content: Like alot say, rooms are small but are comfortable. The location could not be better. The entrance to the hotel is on the border of the Red light district, it is a short walk to Central station (5-10min with luggage) which takes you to the airport. (do not take the taxi as it will cost about 40 euro from the airport and only a couple on the train.) We stayed on the street side which was slightly noisy however did not effect sleep in any way. If we return we will certainly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The smallest "extra large deluxe double room" I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: PeterCG
Reviews.Content: If this hotel had been cheap I might just about forgive its outrageous claim that the tiny room I stayed in was an "extra large deluxe double room". (See my video at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p3YJTdZwA9M ) But it wasn't cheap, and the room was pretty spartan. I did ask the staff if I had been put in the correct room, they confirmed that I had but offered me another room, that seemed the same size but seemed rather dark and gloomy, which I declined. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is in a very central location, very close to Centraal railway station, a few minutes' walk from Dam Square and so on. But central Amsterdam is eminently walkable (and the trams are very good too); furthermore, not all visitors will anyway want to be staying in such a rowdy street. On my next visit I will stay somewhere a bit further out, and would recommend others to consider doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages, in this case, small room but excellent...”
Reviews.Author: KathrynW888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel CC over the weekend and was extremely pleased with it. The hotel staff were very friendly and professional, the location was smack bang in the happening zone with lots of restaurants and pubs, plus walking distance to the red light district. Whilst the room was compact, it was modern, very clean and designed cleverly to fit everything in a very small place. The bed was comfortable and sheets crisp and clean. I was very happy with Hotel CC and would recommend it highly for singles or couples, only because a family with kids will find it hard to fit in the small rooms and the area not a suitable location for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TomGarg
Reviews.Content: Liked : modern design, cleanliness, hotel recently refurbished, kindness of staff, located in the heart of the city Disliked : room quite small and with low ceiling, lack of a smoking zone, no breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in a Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kasi018
Reviews.Content: I was spectical of Staying at this Hotel due to the revies. The hotel is about five months old and is in a prime location if you are a first time visiotor. The rooms were very clean and modern. I had a deluxe room and I would only advise booking one of the larger sweets. The single and small double rooms are very, very tiny. The bathroom could have been larger but overall the room was quite comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Location was brilliant the room was super compact”
Reviews.Author: envbecky
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent and there is a good range of restaurants and cafe on the same road, and is very close to the train station. The room was very small (we got a very cheap deal for 4 nights as 1 night was free) but it had a canal view, and was fully functional (although there wasn't a wardrobe - just draws under the bed. The modern decor was great, and the bed had a proper double bed mattress not two single beds pushed together. The room is decorated and looks lovely and modern. We were there over valentines day weekend and had a great time in Amsterdam. Its location is brilliant and I would recommend the hotel on this basis!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but perfect for one night”
Reviews.Author: KasC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ce Ce hotel for just one night and it was perfect. I had been looking into some of the other cheaper hotels that are further from the center, but felt as a single woman traveling alone it would've been a bit dangerous. The location of the Ce Ce was great, I stumbled right into the hotel when I left the train station. I booked a single room, and they aren't kidding when they say it's for only one person. I could barely turn around in there without walking into something. However it was perfectly clean and safe, and updated so I was very happy with it. Also the view at night from my window was amazing. I only had a small roller suitcase with me, but I think if I had anything bigger it wouldn't have fit in the room. And despite being in the heart of all the 'coffeshops', it was really quiet at night. I slept perfectly and didn't need the earplugs that I had brought. It also helps that I booked this hotel through my Citibank Thankyou network, so it was basically free for me to stay, which is even better! I would stay here again no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel, with some mod cons - but need to work on customer relations!”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel on another site, and got a very good rate of 414 euros for 3 rooms for 2 nights - at least 200 euros less than the next best price for our dates at other similar style hotels with access for wheelchair user. After booking, I found the thread about the mysterious hotel CC and was very worried. Have just returned. literally landed an hour ago, and wanted to post my review while everything is fresh in my mind, so here goes from the begining... When we booked, via the hotels web-site which redirected us to Hoteliers, we booked 2 double rooms - 1 of which was to be accessable for a wheelchair user - and 1 twin. We also, to make sure as it was important, emailed the hotel and put our requests to them, quoting the booking reference given to us by hoteliers. After sending this email we received 3 requests for credit card information, however my email server had put these mails in my spam box, and as I only go through spam every blue moon, just before deleting it, I didnt find them until a few days before the trip. I emailed hoteliers to check, as we had arranged when we booked with them to guarantee rooms with credit card, but to pay cash in euros on arrival at the hotel. They said it was still the case, the hotel just waned to pre-check the card incase we did not show so they could charge the cancelation fee of one nights stay. However, the day before our trip they debited the credit card for the full cost of the stay. It wouldnt have been a problem if they had stated at the begining, that because they were offering a special 'opening offer' rate, it needed advance payment, but please be aware this may happen when you book. On arraval at the hotel, we were told that the room for the wheelchair user was a twin on the third floor ( not a problem because there is a lift, I thought) but then the man described it is only up and down a few steps then round the corner that might be difficult in the chair! We checked the other rooms we had been allocated, all of which were actually twins, and the one for the teenage girls on the ground floor was the only one accessable ( the third was on floor 4 - not served by the lift), so we took that, after a lot of trouble with the reception man to explain - he kept insisting the room on floor 3 was better, just mind the stairs. Once in the room, we had room 003, it was nicely decorated, and very modern in feel - but just small. There were 2 twin beds next to each other, filled with pillos and cushions, a nice crisp white duvet trimmed with grey covers. There was a large wall mounted flat screen tv, tea and coffee facilities, an free electronic safe, and a chair. Also, there is a phone to ring room to room, however in 2 of the 3 rooms we had the inter room service was not working. There were no wardrobes or drawers for clothes and no space to store them really, however, as we were only there for 2 nights it was no big deal to live out of our suitcase but for any longer - or a special occasion where clothes need to be hung - it may be a problem. In the bathroom, which again was small, there was a shower with glass panel seperating it from the toilet area and basin. It also had a hairdryer. The shower had a large shower head, and a smaller, hand neld shower attachment, so you could use either, as suited. There were soap and shampoo/shower gel also provided, although it was a bit gloopy, and not particularly nice smelling, but saves taking your own if traveling with hand luggage only, with todays restrictions on liquids in mind. As previous reports have stated, the air conditioning/heating cannot be turned off , just down and up. We had it on its highest setting, as it was freezing out. The room was quite cool, but did warm up, however we didnt turn temp down at all day or night. It wasnt too cold, but I would prefer to go there in the spring/summer than winter. Towels and bed linen, were clean and nice, and changed daily. There is a vending area in the reception, which offers drinks (soft and alcoholic - 2.50 euros for a can of heiniken) and snacks (1 euro a chocolate bar), and coissants can be bought at breakfast time and eaten in the 'eat and relax' area downstairs (not accessable by lift) down there there are tables to eat snacks or take aways that can be brought into hotel, and also a computer. The hotel did not have complimentary maps, so told us to look at leaflets for tourist attractions which may have maps, nor do they offer any sort of Concierge service - in fact when we were checking out and I asked if they would post my postcards - which were already stamped - they just said no, post box is near central station. The hotels location can be seen as a plus if you are looking to stay close to the nightlife of the notorious area of town, without being in the middle of it, but only 2 streets away from the moulin rouge. It would be more of a minus if you are traveling with children or older maiden aunts with a dodgy heart! There are plenty of cafes and bars on the street, as well as a number of coffeshops and some 'toy' shops - if you know what I mean. There are also several restaurants, including chinese, spanish, indonesian, argantinian and italian, along the street. The shuttle from the airport does not pick up at this hotel, so if you plan using this service, if you want a return, book to go go either the hotel Barbizon Palace (200m down Warmeosstasse) or Hotel Terminus (150m turn right then left) Cost of this is 24.50 euros. We asked for our hotel and the conexxions desk said we do not do return there and were going to sell us one way only - which works out more expensive, but the accepted return to other hotels as above without problem. The station is also within waling distance - about 10 min walk away (approx 350yrds). Would stay here again if I got the same sort of rate and request the room I have used before but also check by phone, and would expect my card to be changed in advance regardless of what they say.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for city centre!”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Amsterdam, I can confidently say this hotel is great quality. I paid 55 euros a night for a single room, which was very clean, warm and welcoming. Yes the rooms are 'small' but once you have stayed in a few Amsterdam hotels, you will understand what an incredible place this is. I advise asking for a room overlooking the back of the hotel. As another review says, laying on your bed, watching the canal and Damrak crowds, is price less. Perfect city centre spot. Staff very friendly and accommodating. 24 hour snacks available and free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you like a broom closet”
Reviews.Author: Lilpop
Reviews.Content: Boutique Hotel means really, really small. The bathroom was the same size as the room. They don't show the 'standard' room on their site - and there's a reason for that. There's no room even to have a standard sized suitcase in the standard size room. Windows are not double glazed so rooms can get really cold without heating (has the tight card in the slot mechanism to turn on the power. Redeeming feature was the view from the bedroom window as the hotel sits on a canal. It's also in the heart of Amsterdam but that also means it's noisy and attracts boofhead British yobbo males over for whatever this strange tribe come to Amsterdam for. I tossed up whether to choose this or the Swisshotel as the pricing was similar. Should have gone for the Swisshotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for exploring & enjoying Amsterdam!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheTuncs
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms through 'easytobook'. Arrived a while before check-in time so left our luggage in the luggage room. Checked in no problem after 1400. Rooms are of a great standard, very clean & modern. Although the rooms are quite small there is more than enough room for your luggage, getting washed & changed etc. We found the beds to be extremely comfortable. Hotel staff all very friendly & helpful. Hotel in a perfect location: Approx 5mins walk from Centraal Station, a couple of minutes from Dam Square & red light district, approx 20min walk from Anne Frank Huis. All in all this hotel was the perfect base for us for the weekend, in a great location - not too far to walk to all attractions. It was clean, modern & friendly & very reasonably priced for a city centre hotel. We will definately go back to this hotel & certainly would recommend to others. Great weekend! Recommend a restaurant called 'Dam Plaza' close to Dam Square on the bottom end of Damrak - The steak was fantastic!! Also recommend Baba coffeeshop on the same street at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Short Breaks to Explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: RachGD
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location of this hotel, it IS VERY close to the red light district but this did not bother me at all. It is on the strip that runs parallel to the Damrak and the back of the hotel has rooms that look over the hotel and the front of the hotel looks out onto the main strip that has lots of Coffee Shops, Cafes and places to eat. It is lively, some will see this as a bonus - others if you are going for a more cultural visit wont like it, you'd be better off staying near the museum quarter if thats what you are after. We couldn't have asked for a better location though! So central! The rooms are small but as far as I can understand spacious hotels arent so easy to come by in Amsterdam unless you are looking for something more like a 4* or 5* hotel, especially when they are in old buildings so I was expecting this. It is true though that if you were staying for a long period of time you may want a bigger room, but for 3 nights it was fine. I can agree the aircon isnt the quiestest I have ever heard but I didnt really see it as a major problem. There was no problem with the heating when we went, as I was worried it would be cold as people have commented on other sites that the heating was not working, but our room got quite toasty, which was good as it was freezing over there!!! The rooms were clean, bed was sooo comfy and warm! The shower was amazing. I really need a shower like that at home :) I loved the way the room was decorated. The whole hotel was clean and fresh. There was a lift which was a bonus. Clean towels every day. Bathrooms were lovely and clean and fresh, small, but i would rather have a good shower in a clean bathroom than some of the dirty showers i have seen in a big bathroom. with all those horrible shower curtains and dirty tiles! One word of advice, if you check in early, ask for a room with canal view, it will be quieter, as I mentioned it is on a lively street and the rooms on the front, you can hear some people in the street. They tried to give me room 101 when I first checked in but I refused this as it is on the ground floor, window to the street and I did not like this as there is a lot of people traffic on that street. The staff were very friendly and were so helpful when I asked to change rooms etc. I would definately recommend this hotel to people who are after the same kind of break as me, to discover the city warts and all as there is some hocking stuff round there, but not to older people or families as the area is very lively!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jessicasweep
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel was great the rooms were very clean as the hotel is new,however after the first night we had to be moved because the air con was making to much noise and it coludnt be switched off at all??and there was banging from next door because of building work in a restaurant.the staff were very pleasant and understood.the rooms were beautifully decorated and beds were very comfortable, we had quite a big room which was great for are 4 night stay.on are last day my boyfriend nearly got hit in the head by the lamp shade which fell from the celling and the towel rail near a came out of the sockett as i was getting a towel the night before!!attention to detail is needed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cold, draughty, tiny rooms in a sleazy area”
Reviews.Author: DavyRos
Reviews.Content: Convenient to central station and Dam Square. On the edge of the Red Light District ,surrounded with sex/gay shops and coffee shops for the pot smokers. Tiny rooms with noisy aircon. Rooms have single glazed sash windows which are no match for a biting February wind or a noisy street. I would give it a miss. On a plus side, the staff are friendly and the hotel is kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond In The Rough!”
Reviews.Author: Rebs_LFC
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam for the 8th time & it was the best hotel I've ever stayed in :) My friend & I stayed here from 28th Jan - 2nd Feb. In a 3rd floor basic twin. All we wanted was comfortable beds & clean rooms but as there wasn't much info on the hotel or pics of where abouts it was we were a little bit anxious!!! I can't stress enough how CLEAN it is! Room hoovered daily, towels changed, polished, fresh tea/coffee facilities. I also had the a few of the best nights sleep ever! Bed was so warm & comfortable. Room wasn't massive but it had enough space for all our luggage & things. Can't believe how good this hotel was. Will be heading back soon! Never fancied staying right in the centre before but this hotel is in the perfect location. Coffeeshops, bars & shops on your doorstep, few minutes walk to Dam Sq, tram stops & eateries. Really friendly staff, a lift (so no luggage issues), decent room hairdryer, flat screen tv with BBC channels, nice decor, lovely hot shower & safe deposit box. Honestly can't think of any bad bits! Really pleased. A true hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “A great birthday in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam25
Reviews.Content: Hi, i am very happy about my holiday in Amsterdam is my 12th time in this city and this the best accomodation for all the people that want live the Amsterdam nigth and day life near the train station and really near to Dam square the principal square everything is very near red ligth area pub coffee shop canals bakeies and all . best whishes

HotelInfo.Address: Warmoesstraat 42, Amsterdam 1012 JE, The Netherlands
